span.span: As our staff and school district continues to navigate the mandated closures due to COVID-19, we will provide updated information at www.perued.net. At this time, Governor Pritzker's order requires schools to remain physically closed
through April 30. We will continue to update you here on our schedules and cancellations.

The school district is making every effort to provide meaningful learning activities at home. Please go to our eLearning Central for learning activities for each grade level and for more detailed information.

font.span: The Northview and Parkside offices are currently closed. The district office (located at the main east entrance of Parkside School) is open on weekdays from 8:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. We will have staff available to assist with whatever children or parents need. If you have any questions, call us anytime at 815-223-1111 and press extension 5.

span.span: Aside from scheduled Board of Education meetings and necessary district office functions, all district activities and meetings will be canceled or postponed during the mandated closing. The PTC Ties and Tiaras Dance that was scheduled for April 25 has also been canceled.

We will continue to update you with any continued closures or rescheduled events including 8th grade graduation, but it would be premature to do so at this time. I anticipate that we will know by around April 21 if there is a chance of students physically returning to school. The final official day of the school year for students will remain as Wednesday, May 27.

As always, thank you for the privilege of allowing us to teach your kids! We are in uncharted waters here, and we will continue to do the very best that we can. Thank you, hang with us and the principals and I will continue to communicate with you on behalf of our district and staff. Please feel free to reach out anytime
at 815-223-1111 x5, or by emailing mcross@perued.net. Thank you!

Mark R. Cross, Superintendent
Peru Elementary School District 124
